definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
respectfully yours (at the end of a letter)

sentences.english: So he prostrated and praised the Guru for such great favors.
sentences.chinese: 所以他敬禮與稱讚上師給予他如斯大恩。

sentences.english: The sergeant brought the guards to attention and saluted the inspection officer.
sentences.chinese: 中士令衛隊立正並向檢閱官敬禮。

sentences.english: The soldier clicked his heels and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 那個兵兩腳跟咔嗒一聲，立正敬禮。

sentences.english: Students see teacher seven meters outside to salute.
sentences.chinese: 學生見到老師七米外要敬禮。

sentences.english: The policeman would stand and salute.
sentences.chinese: 這時，警察就會肅立敬禮。
士兵們向軍官舉手敬禮。

sentences.english: I told the scouts to stop saluting me,” he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，“我告訴巡防隊員不必朝我敬禮。

sentences.english: Salutations, black earth, be strong and alert.
sentences.chinese: 敬禮，黑色的大地，強壯而又機警。

sentences.english: The guard saluted the officer in the car.
sentences.chinese: 警衛向車上的軍官敬禮。

sentences.english: In comparison, Huangping County’s policy of roadside salutes is arguably benign.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，黃平縣的路上敬禮並不那麼惡劣。
我向一個無名之輩敬禮。

sentences.english: The sergeant brought the guard smartly to attention and saluted the inspecting officer.
sentences.chinese: 班長令衛隊立正並向檢閱官敬禮。

definition: to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to atone for one's crime/to buy freedom from punishment/redemption/atonement
to pray/to pray for sth/to wish sth/prayer/wish
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
